comment: Oh my word I love this man, favorite professor by far!! Super sweet, friendly and genuinely passionate about what he teaches. Hard class but stay engaged and you will do well. He provides thorough study guides for his exams and will give back points if the majority of the class missed a question on an exam. Please take this man, he is the best!!!

I found him a bit soft-spoken and monotonous which made class pretty boring. There was usually at least one student asleep in class. His slides doesn't have much either, so you'll have to try your best to listen to him the whole time too. If you didn't do too well in A&P, you'll probably need the textbook for the class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: He is a cool dude. He answers questions emailed to him fast and detailed. The people that don't like his class only like things that come easy in life. You have to study hard for his class ... not because of how he teaches but because that's the reality of the material. He's a respectable guy!

Dr. Buresh is knowledgeable, funny, and caring. This class was made up of 5 tests (1 being a cumulative final) and take-home quizzes throughout the semester (you need to be in class to hear the passwords to get in). He also updated the study guides for each unit as they progressed and did virtual class reviews. He has your best interest, take him.

If there is another professor, please choose the other professor. He assumes that we know a lot of background information before starting his class. His exams are worded very tricky and his study guides are very confusing. You have a quiz after every class with a password, but is open notes. I read through the textbook to help me.

He is knowledgeable; however, the "study guides" for the exams are long & confusing. Some things are difficult to find in the PPTs. Quizzes almost every day after class (password protected so you have to be in class to get the password). Pay attention to how he writes his quiz questions. Exam grades make up 400/500 of your points! Won't take again.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Buresh is amazing! The material is heavy, but he makes it so understanding! He posts study guides about a week before an exam, and they are really helpful. He also holds review sessions the day of the exam. Attend class because you will have a quiz(password required)after every lecture. He is hilarious as well, so you will get a good laugh in!

Absolutely loved this professor. Out of a lecture of 100+ students, he takes time to get to know all students interested in ES and push them. Responds quickly to emails and is willing to explain anything. Make it a point to get on name basis terms he truly wants you to succeed. Quizzes after every class do them (answers in lecture notes you take)
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: I LOVE Dr. Buresh! He is SUPER sincere and nice. His class is super easy - 4 exams, 1 final (which he drops if you are content w/ ur grade), and attendance codes. He is super knowledgeable in the field so he lectures in more detail than what you need to know for the exams but he gives exam reviews that are gold. Lectures are boring but he's not!

I took the class over the summer. He was very clear with what was expected. He gave a password for daily quizzes. I missed 2 quizzes out of 15 and still made an A. He's very generous with giving credit for questions you missed if he feels he didn't cover the topic enough. He knows his stuff but doesn't make the class harder than it needs to be.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He is extremely passionate about the subject, and is pretty funny. Sometimes the lectures get a little boring, but hey it's college. He gives extremely thorough study guides that are super long. There's nothing on the test that isn't on his study guide. Class was pretty straightforward. Didn't have homework. Just quizzes and tests.
rating_tags: Participation matters--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Clear grading criteria

comment: Lectures are boring and a brief repeat of anatomy which makes it easy if you passed A&P. A lot of people take this course before A&P or even chemistry which makes it much more difficult. Take A&P first and you'll get an A. Do the study guides, answers are on quizlet. GET THE QUIZ PASSWORDS. that can save your grade.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He is very knowledgable and passionate, I think he's also funny. He talks ALOT. Posts power points online. Gives long study guides (very helpful for the test). It was his first time teaching Nutrition and Performance so I'd say he did good. There is a reaserch project due at the end of class worth a test grade.
Very nice guy. He's passionate about what he teaches. Go to class to get the quiz passwords. Gives long study guides for tests.

Dr. Buresh is a very nice and knowledgeable guy. Attendance is not mandatory but he does give in class passwords you have to have for his quizzes. His notes can be a bit confusing because he abbreviates a lot. You will never use the book for this class, don't waste your money. He is very helpful if you have questions. Overall really good. Take him!

Since I took his class online, I don't really know how Professor Buresh is in the classroom. But online, he was very helpful and always there if you had any questions. The class was a lot of work, and the tests were kind of tough. But I definitely recommend him as a professor!

Exams are VERY easy if you attend and pay attention.  Gives wonderful study guides, but make sure you also know how to do calculations.  Most time is spent on labs, and they are the bulk of your grade.  He is very helpful and will happily answer questions if you present them.

Great teacher!!! Very knowledgable and always willing to help. No attendance policy, but he gives 5 pt quizzes that add up to a test grade. He gives study guides before ECG test that can be rather long, but very informative on test material

Buresh was a great teacher! Passionate about the subject and can keep us entertained with his jokes and voice imitations. A lot of the content can be confusing if you haven't taken bio or anatomy yet(I haven't), but the tests were 4 easy multiple choice tests with study guides. Find a friend to give quiz passwords when you can't make it to class.

Professor Buresh is a cool guy. He makes jokes in class that are super funny. However, he loads the information on thick so if you havent taken Anatomy yet, it can be difficult to follow. His quizzes are difficult and his study guides are usually 6 or 7  pages long. As long as you study hard for the tests you should be okay.

Dr. Buresh is one of the best professors I've ever had. I really learn a lot in his class, and he's super helpful if you need it. His assignments are pretty elementary but you do have to study for his tests (welcome to college) but besides that he's a down to earth guy just doing his job and cares about his students. Very knowledgeable too

It's nutrition... and chemistry and bioenergetics are hard concepts to grasp. I recommend you walk into this class with Chem 1 and 2 under under your belt. He is incredibly knowledgeable and he is easy, the SUBJECT is not. Talk to him and he will guide you to the A you want.

Very Challenging. Tests are not necessarily consistent with the power points. Power points tend to be long (<80 slides). Required reading and studying daily or you will fall behind. Test questions are really detailed, so make sure you know your information. Great information and a great instructor. If you make it out alive, you will know your stuff

Dr. Buresh is my favorite professor at KSU. He is extremely helpful and approachable. His tests are just like his powerpoint slides and his study guides are extremely helpful. I would recommend taking Dr. Buresh with any class that you possibly can.

Great guy. He was very helpful throughout the semester. Lectures are a little run-on, but only b/c I didn't really like the subject. He is passionate about the class and very knowledgable. Labs are easy. Tests, you have to go to class and study for. Attend not mand, but u need to be there.

Don't let the reviews on here fool you. Going to class is a HUGE help in making an A or B in the class. I attended about 70% of the classes and pulled a C. Tests are somewhat challenging only because of amount of material. He's a friendly guy with a good heart.

He's incredibly nice and does care about his students doing well. The tests can be hard because there's so much information. The lectures can be boring, but attendance isn't required. However, he discusses things that aren't on his powerpoints or the book in class. Labs are easy and you won't be doing any intense exercise.

I have had two of his classes and I learned a lot! He is an awesome teacher and he really cares about you learning the material. Very friendly and helpful! One of my favs in the HPS dept. Tests require ample study time, so be prepared. He gives study guides and review days but you still have to work to make the grade. I would definitely recommend.

He was the WORST teacher that I had. I attended every class eventhough it was not mandatory and took notes and still failed all of the test. You never understand what he is saying he just goes off on rants. I would advise to NEVER take him as a teacher!!!

Very easy class, the tests do get harder as the semester goes on but everything is in the notes and he gives study guides. A few assignments outside class that is required but he's lenient on them. Things can be turned in late for a few points off. There are some extra credit opportunities so they can help you get an easy A.

Clinical was the most boring class I can remember taking.  Lectures were powerpoint - and after McLester, you're just spoiled.  He droned on and on... Exams were M/C and essay.  But, on the upside, he tries - and he's willing to work with you on just about anything.
Dr. Buresh is a great teacher.  He goes over the material well and is lenient about receiving assignments on time.  I recommend him.  The labs are easy.  He is also very helpful.

Nice guy. Sometimes can be boring but the material is pretty easy. Just do the study guides for the tests and you'll do fine. Attendance not mandatory but if you want to do well, you should try to attend regularly.

Mr.Buresh is a great teacher!! He loves his students and he is passionate about helping students build a healthy life! He is goofy sometimes but really sweet! He makes class fun and interesting. He gives you a thorough study guide so tests are easy.He gives a lot of extra credit! Labs are easy! No big excersizes!If u don't get an A+ your crazy.
